DOC.brief_title: Healthy Volunteer Visibility Study of Micromachined Tags for the Detection of Surgical Sponges
DOC.detailed_description: Surgical sponges can be accidentally left inside patient's bodies. We are working on special tags (called microfabricated tags) that surgeons can put on their sponges. Then, if the surgeons forget to remove a sponge from a patient, they'll be able to detect these special tags in an x-ray. We wish to take x-rays of healthy people's abdomens with microfabricated tags lying on them. The x-rays will help us improve our system for detecting sponges left inside people's bodies.
DOC.criteria: 1. Healthy men and women 2. Ages 18 or older 1. Under 18 years of age 2. Pregnant female or if female has not had a negative pregnancy test prior to the research scans.
